title: Queen's Speech 2019 live: The Queen leaves Buckingham Palace for Westminster
text:
The Queen today leads the State Opening of Parliament despite Britain being mired chaos over Brexit.

The monarch is due to announce 22 new Bills for the coming year at 11.30am in the Queen's Speech - her first for two years.

Yet almost no one expects Boris Johnson's flailing administration to last out the year.

We are in historic, unprecedented times as the PM governs with a majority close to minus 50 and struggles to get a Brexit deal.

The speech includes 'half-baked' plans to boost migrants who move to the north ; a Domestic Abuse Bill; scrapping railway franchising; criminal sanctions for breaching building regulations; and keeping criminals in jail for longer in a Tory U-turn.

Chancellor Sajid Javid also announced he'll hold a Budget on November 6 - if there's a Brexit deal.
description: The monarch is set to announce 22 new bills at the state opening of Parliament as wrangling over Brexit is set to continue
